##Diary of the siege of Wuhan | Day 9

Techread

Features, Lanxi, founder of zhulu.com  , focuses on in-depth observations and business reviews of Internet startups, new media, and subcultures.

In accordance with the law of past years, it has come to the day of rework, the Railway Kawa no Nagare no Y≈ç Ni, flight shuttle density, the center of the collection, the speed up, the world is full of new exciting atmosphere.

In the ill-fated 2020, finally ushered in the highest alert from the WHO: New Crown Pneumonia constitutes an international public health emergency (PHEIC) .

In other words, this is no longer a matter of a few people eating game or a locked city, the virus does not respect the rules of sovereignty, borders and customs as nothing, is to beat with the pulse of the world.

The last public health emergency to be declared an international emergency was a Zaire ebolavirus in west Africa, where a New Yorker contributor wrote an earlier book, "the plague of blood. " Zaire Ebolavirus, who chronicled the discovery and understanding of the Zaire Ebolavirus, invited Stephen King to write the book.

Yes, the one that's famous for its horror novels and scares the hell out of hundreds of millions of readers. What's the comment from the Stephen King, Stephen King?

The first chapter of this book is the scariest thing I've ever read in my life. "

Take a look at the story that scared the Stephen King out of its pants

Well, let's just say the humor and wit of the publishing industry, it really knows people. But that's not what I'm talking about, that's what the blood plague is about, how to sustain human dignity in these fragile times.

The disease is by no means as deadly as the Zaire Ebolavirus, Florida, which at one point had a mortality rate of 90% , including China's infrastructure and economic resources, and more so than the African continent, there is no reason why this disaster can not be overcome.

But sadly, many unexpected events continue to play out in highly penetrating ways.

Yes, there is an objective mortality rate for NCP, so for those infected with the disease, there will be deaths, not that they deserve to die, but that they do contain force majeure, is Not subject to the will of man.

And what I want to say today is that these days, there are some incidents, that are not directly related to the virus itself, but have had intolerable consequences.

For example, the child with cerebral palsy who died of starvation at home after his father was quarantined, or a tricycle driver who was cut off from the road by a person and a vehicle and fell down in mid-air when he passed a road blocked by a pull rope, even the home of Wuhan Returnees with wooden bars and iron fence nailed to death, these things are how to happen?

It's a human tragedy that could have been avoided.

To ignore the dignity of being born human is nothing more than a virus, and to give a forklift a hundred endearing anthropomorphic nicknames is no more attractive than a real person.

"Don't ask the For Whom the Bell Tolls. The bell tolls for you. " 

This is my diary of the siege of Wuhan, day nine.
